results.title: Java: island of culture
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Illustrates the traditional Javanese arts of wood carving, painting, Batik dyeing, Wayang Kulit and Wayang Wong theatre as they are today, and briefly tours some of the ancient temples of the Island. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Indonesian development action
results.creator_credit: Ian Harris and Australian Development Assistance Bureau
results.brief_description: Australian assistance to Indonesia includes research into agriculture and food production, and engineering works such as road building. Australia also provides training for these ventures, which ensures that Indonesia has her own qualified workers. Narrated by Clive Robertson.

results.title: Indonesia builds a better life
results.brief_description: Indonesia, since gaining independence, has begun a series of new developments. Thousands of men and women are being taught to read and write as part of a campaign to eradicate illiteracy. An attempt is being made to control the spread of the disease Framboesia, commonly known as yaws. Those already suffering from the disease are given on the spot treatment. While this medical attention is being given research workers are constantly checking its results, and reporting to the World Health Organisation.

results.title: Bali: island of gods and demons
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Bali, one of the many islands that make up the Indonesian nation, is a tropical paradise. Religion plays a great part in the daily life of the people and we see many fine temples and some of their religious ceremonies. Narrated by Roger Climpson. No other credits available.

results.title: Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
What makes this diverse chain of islands into a nation? Indonesia’s national motto “Unity in diversity” is the film’s starting point in its concentration on Sumatra, Java and Bali - the most populated areas. One of the most interesting sequences is an examination of the Indonesian concept of power - that there is a finite amount of it in the world. Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.

results.title: Individualised instruction
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk, University of New South Wales and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Considers the use of tape-slide combinations as a strategy for teaching large undergraduate classes. Two methods of utilisation are discussed. Considers underlying principles such as feedback and student participation, the practicalities of cost and program construction, and attempts to evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of this medium.

results.title: Individual progress in reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Reading Development”.
Examines the provision for individual progress in reading at two American schools. Two reading improvement specialists are seen operating different aspects of their respective reading programs. The schools are located on airbases in Oxfordshire.

results.title: [Individual motivation and behavior]
results.creator_credit: Russell Morasi, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Deals with individual motivation and behaviour in groups, explaining why people join groups and why some members block or dominate group action. Presents a demonstration and discusses the motivation of each participant in the demonstration.

results.title: The Individual in the modern world
results.brief_description: The Corning Foundation and the American Council of Learned Societies in 1961 co-sponsored a second Corning conference on the theme “The Individual and the modern world”. Distinguished Americans and other world figures held informal sessions on work, education and leisure. These far ranging discussions became the subject for this film.

results.title: Individual differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
The case study of a shy, slow child, who is different from his classmates and from his older, socially-adept brother, whose reputation is a constant reminder of his own shortcomings. Everyone needs to succeed, the film points out, and most of all those in terms of individual interests and capabilities. It is the job of the school to shape education to these individual needs.
